meanings.definition: Past tense of 'wring': to twist or squeeze forcefully
meanings.sent1: She wrang the wet towel to remove excess water.
meanings.sent2: He wrang his hands in frustration.
meanings.sent3: The cat wrang itself into a tight ball to fit into the small box.
meanings.sent4: The old tree roots wrang around the buried treasure.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler wrang his opponent's arm to gain the upper hand.

meanings.definition: Past tense of 'wrangle': to argue or dispute angrily
meanings.sent1: They wrang over the last piece of cake at the party.
meanings.sent2: The siblings wrang about whose turn it was to do the dishes.
meanings.sent3: The birds outside seemed to wrang loudly about something.
meanings.sent4: The thunder and lightning wrang in the stormy sky.
meanings.sent5: The neighbors wrang over the property line for years.

meanings.definition: Past tense of 'wring': to extract or obtain by force or pressure
meanings.sent1: She wrang the information out of the reluctant witness.
meanings.sent2: He wrang a confession out of the suspect.
meanings.sent3: The chef wrang the flavors out of the fresh herbs for the sauce.
meanings.sent4: The detective wrang the truth out of the suspect with clever questioning.
meanings.sent5: The negotiator wrang a compromise out of the opposing parties.
